required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SG001 in Combination With Nab-Paclitaxel in Patients With Advanced Triple-Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Open-label, Multicenter, Phase II Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SG001 in Combination With Nab-Paclitaxel in Patients With Advanced Triple-Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC)

lead_sponsor.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-arm, open-label, multicenter, phase II study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of SG001 in combination with Nab-paclitaxel in patients with advanced TNBC.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a single-arm, open label, multicenter phase II study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of SG001 in combination with nab-paclitaxel in patients with unresectable locally advanced, or recurrent, or metastatic TNBC. Eligible patients will receive SG001 intravenous infusion at a dose of 240 mg on Days 1 and 15 of every 4-week cycle and nab-paclitaxel intravenous infusion at a dose of 100 mg/m^2 on Days 1, 8, and 15 of every 4-week cycle until disease progression, or intolerable toxicity, or other discontinuation or termination criteria are met, for a maximum of 2 years.

primary_outcome.description: ORR will be assessed by RECIST 1.1 criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival (PFS) in patients with combined positive score (CPS) ≥ 10
Objective response rate (ORR) in patients with CPS ≥ 10
Duration of response (DOR) in patients with CPS ≥ 10
Disease control rate (DCR) in patients with CPS ≥ 10
Overall survival (OS) in patients with CPS ≥ 10

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period, with an average of 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Serum Concentration (Cmax) for SG001 Maximum Serum Concentration for SG001 Maximum Serum Concentration (Cmax) for SG001
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycle 1 (each cycle is 28 days)
Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycle 1 (each cycle is 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of Total and Free Paclitaxel
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1. End of nab-paclitaxel infusion, 4 hours after end of nab-paclitaxel infusion on Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycle 1 (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma Concentrations of Total and Free Paclitaxel

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between clinical characteristics and efficacy
other_outcome.description: Clinical characteristics includes intestinal flora, gene mutations, PD-L1 expression, biomarkers, etc.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive SG001 intravenously at a dose of 240 mg on Days 1 and 15 of every 4-week cycle in combination with nab-paclitaxel at a dose of 100 mg/m^2 on Days 1, 8, and 15 of every 4-week cycle until disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity, or other discontinuation or termination criteria are met.

intervention.description: Recombinant Anti-PD-1 Fully Human Monoclonal Antibody Injection, 240 mg, i.v., q2w
Paclitaxel for Injection (Albumin Bound), 100 mg/m^2, i.v., D1, D8, D15 of every 4-week cycle

overall_official.affiliation: Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital,Sun Yat-sen University
Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital,Sun Yat-sen University

facility.name: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
